titles.title: Anaktuvuk Pass Land Exchange and Wilderness Redesignation Act of 1994
Anaktuvuk Pass Land Exchange and Wilderness Redesignation Act of 1994
A bill to provide for the exchange of lands within Gates of the Arctic National Park and Preserve, and for other purposes.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S9454-9455)
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

committee.name: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

action.text: Referred to Subcommittee on Public Lands, National Parks.

committee.name: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

action.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources requested executive comment from Department of the Interior, and Office of Management and Budget.

committee.name: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

action.text: Subcommittee on Public Lands, National Parks. Hearings held.

committee.name: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

calendar.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported with amendments favorably.

action.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported to Senate by Senator Johnston with amendments. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 652.

action.text: By Senator Johnston from Committee on Energy and Natural Resources filed written report. Report No. 103-425.

committee.name: Senate Energy and Natural Resources
committee.subcommittee: Public Lands, National Parks and Forests

bill.summary: 9/27/1994--Reported to Senate amended. Anaktuvuk Pass Land Exchange and Wilderness Redesignation Act of 1994 - Ratifies and confirms the agreement among the United States, the Arctic Slope Regional Corporation, the Nunamiut Corporation, and the city of Anaktuvuk Pass executed on December 17, 1992. Requires the lands acquired by the United States pursuant to such Agreement to be administered by the Secretary of the Interior as part of the Gates of the Arctic National Park and Preserve. Amends the Alaska National Interest Lands Conservation Act to provide for: (1) the addition and the rescission of lands within the Gates of the Arctic Wilderness; and (2) the addition of lands to the Noatak National Preserve and the Noatak Wilderness.
